output: In Borsec, Romania, over the course of a week starting from February 3rd to February 7th, temperatures will remain below freezing point throughout all days with actual readings ranging between -10.55°C and -4.01°C at their highest during midday hours on Tuesday before rising slightly by the end of the week up to -3°C. The weather is expected to be predominantly cold, snowy conditions with temperatures feeling even colder due to wind chill factors between -6.92°C and -14.06°C at their lowest points on Monday evening and Tuesday morning respectively. Winds will vary in speed from 1 m/s up to a gust of 3.57 m/s, with the strongest wind occurring early Friday afternoon reaching this peak value. Cloud coverage varies significantly throughout the week starting at all-sky conditions on Monday and decreasing over time until only clear skies are observed by midweek before increasing again towards Thursday evening to mostly cloudy or broken clouds for most of Wednesday, with snow expected in some instances as well. By Friday morning there will be a few scattered clouds but the day is predicted to end on clearer terms.

In Aşağı Beğdeş, Turkey, over the next five days starting from Monday to Friday, cloud coverage will predominantly range between none and full sky with occasional clouds or scattered/few clouds appearing. Temperatures are expected to fluctuate slightly around mid-teens degrees Celsius during this period without significant variation in temperature highs or lows as the highest 'feels_like' is 16.47°C and the lowest is approximately 3.9°C on Tuesday morning, with wind speeds generally remaining light to moderate at around one meter per second but gusting up to slightly higher levels occasionally. The weather will alternate between clear skies and overcast conditions throughout these days, suggesting variable cloudiness without extreme changes in the sky's appearance or temperature range. Rain is anticipated on Thursday with a 'light rain' forecast accompanied by wind speeds of 1.88-3.94 m/s; however, clear skies return from Friday morning and continue through to Sunday evening as scattered clouds make an occasional presence in the sky but no further precipitation is expected after Thursday night into early next week with temperatures ranging between approximately 2.31°C at its coolest point on Friday mornings, peaking around 4.5-6.95°C during midweek afternoons under overcast conditions and then dropping to a minimum of about 0.98°C by evening with light winds picking up again towards the weekend. Pressure will generally decrease from Monday morning's reading at around 1021 hPa, reaching its lowest on Wednesday night before slightly recovering over Thursday and Friday afternoons.

In Bagay city, Philippines, over the course of the week starting February 3rd to February 7th, there will be a consistent presence of clouds with cloud coverage ranging from 86% up to full (100%). The weather conditions are expected to alternate between light rain and various forms of cloudiness. Temperatures throughout this period range roughly around the low twenties in Celsius, while wind speeds will vary slightly but remain relatively gentle with gusts not exceeding 5.1 meters per second. Feels-like temperatures indicate a slight fluctuation due to humidity and cloud cover effects on perceived temperature. Rainfall is expected at times during this period, peaking yesterday evening with rainfall of up to one millimeter in the last six hours but showing no significant change today as it remains dry or lightly dampened by rain throughout each day's forecast cycle.

In Plouay, France, overcast clouds will dominate from Monday to Friday with temperatures ranging between 3°C and 7.43°C at their highest on Tuesday noon. Feels-like temperature values indicate mild conditions throughout these five days despite the actual air being cooler due to cloud cover. Wind speeds vary, peaking overnight from Wednesday with gusts up to 7.81m/s and calming down towards Friday evening at around 3.6m/s. There will be a slight increase in feels-like temperature on Tuesday afternoon followed by cooler temperatures through the rest of the week, reaching -0.88°C with light rain expected to start midweek which continues into early parts of the next day before clearing up towards Friday evening when overcast clouds return and feel like conditions improve slightly from negative values back above freezing point at 2°C by late afternoon. No precipitation in terms of snow or heavy rainfall is forecasted, but light drizzle on Tuesday night will occur with a slight drop to clear skies expected for the remainder of Wednesday and early Thursday before clouds return again overnight into Friday.

In Santa Maria over the course of the week starting February 3rd to February 7th, residents can expect mostly cloudy skies with varying levels of precipitation and light rain throughout most days. Temperatures will range from a low of approximately 24.47°C on Thursday at noon up to a high nearing 30.33°C on Friday around midday, while the wind speed fluctuates between gentle breezes and stronger gusts reaching up to 3.8 meters per second with calm periods in between. The atmospheric pressure remains relatively steady within the range of 1007-1011 hPa throughout this period. Rainfall is expected, ranging from light showers at about 1 mm/h during early mornings to heavier downpours up to approximately 5.2 mm in a six-hour span on Thursday evening. The weather will alternate between rain and overcast conditions with occasional breaks of few or broken clouds by the week's end.

In Sampiro city for the upcoming week starting February 3rd to February 7th, cloud coverage will generally be high with occasional breaks of scattered and broken clouds throughout each day into Friday evening. Temperatures are expected to remain mild, ranging from a low of approximately 24.8°C on Wednesday at noon up to around 26°C during the afternoon hours across all days. Feels like temperatures will closely mirror actual air temperature due to high humidity levels and cloud cover, suggesting warm conditions despite overcast skies. Light rain is anticipated intermittently with rainfall amounts varying from none on some nights up to 5mm by Thursday afternoon before tapering off towards the weekend; light showers are expected at least three times during this period. Wind speeds will generally be moderate, ranging between 3m/s and 12.76m/s with occasional gusts up to speed of around 12.43m/s on Thursday afternoon. Pressure levels are relatively stable within the range of 1009-1012hPa, indicating consistent weather patterns without significant atmospheric pressure changes.

In El Cazadero, Mexico, over the course of the week starting February 3rd and ending on February 7th, clear skies with no precipitation or snow will prevail throughout each day as indicated by all-day cloud cover readings at zero. Temperatures are expected to range from a low of approximately 7°C during midday hours down to around 12°C in the early morning and evening times, suggesting relatively stable warm weather with slight fluctuations within this narrow band throughout each day. Wind speeds will vary between calm conditions at night (0-1.85 meters per second) up to gusts of about 7.5 m/s during afternoon hours on Thursday and Friday evenings, but overall wind activity remains minimal with no significant changes in speed or direction observed over the five days. The atmospheric pressure will hover between approximately 1012 hPa at its lowest point to a high nearing 1020 hPa, indicating stable weather conditions without any notable drops that could suggest incoming storms. Feels-like temperatures are consistent with actual air temperature readings due to clear skies and lack of precipitation or cloud cover throughout the forecast period.
